intro: Ruellia foliosepala, commonly known as the leaf-covered ruellia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Ruellia foliosepala thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
